arts.ttl: Daniel Farke addresses heated exchange with Blackburn Rovers player after Leeds United setback
arts.sum: Farke, who also spoke to the match officials after the Whites lost for the second time on the road this season, said: "I was frustrated. Leeds United manager Daniel Farke cut a frustrated figure in the wake of their 1-0 loss at Blackburn Rovers.

arts.ttl: What Blackburn Rovers boss John Eustace felt 'played into their hands' against Leeds United
arts.sum: John Eustace believes the Championship fixture schedule "played into their hands" after watching his Blackburn Rovers side dent Leeds United's title charge. However, the Whites failed to find a way past Rovers goalkeeper Aynsley Pears and Eustace's side held on to claim a third straight win.

arts.ttl: Championship: Leeds slip up at Blackburn as Hull’s woes go on at Boro
arts.sum: Tommy Conway strikes twice as Middlesbrough beat Hull Watford equal club-record unbeaten run in QPR impasse Todd Cantwell’s first-half penalty clinched Blackburn a 1-0 victory over Leeds at Ewood Park as Daniel Farke’s side missed out on the chance to return to the top of the Championship. Sheffield United’s defeat of Sunderland a day earlier meant Leeds came into this clash in second spot. And they fell short in their efforts to leapfrog the Blades after Cantwell’s 22nd-minute spot-kick secured Rovers’ third successive win and boosted their playoff challenge. Continue reading...
